member.name: M:STM.Controllers.STMOptimalBusController.Get(System.String,System.String)
member.remarks: Find optimal STM bus to travel between two coordinates
member.param: Latitude, longitude of the first stop
Latitude, longitude of the last stop
member.returns: Json containing the ID of the bus, its trip ID, its name, the ETA, the first and last stops of the trip

member.name: M:STM.Controllers.TrackBusController.Post(STM.Entities.DTO.TrackingBusDTO)
member.remarks: Allows the real-time tracking of a bus. Call-Back will be issued once the bus reached its target destination
member.param: TripID of the bus to track
TripID of the trip taken by the bus to track
ID of the stop at which to begin tracking the bus
ID of the stop at which to stop tracking the bus
Address to call once the tracking is complete
member.returns: Number of real time seconds the bus took to travel from origin to target destinations

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.GtfsRealtimeReflection
member.summary: Holder for reflection information generated from gtfs-realtime.proto

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.GtfsRealtimeReflection.Descriptor
member.summary: File descriptor for gtfs-realtime.proto

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedMessage
member.summary: The contents of a feed message. A feed is a continuous stream of feed messages. Each message in the stream is obtained as a response to an appropriate HTTP GET request. A realtime feed is always defined with relation to an existing GTFS feed. All the entity ids are resolved with respect to the GTFS feed. Note that "required" and "optional" as stated in this file refer to Protocol Buffer cardinality, not semantic cardinality. See reference.md at https://github.com/google/transit/tree/master/gtfs-realtime for field semantic cardinality.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedMessage.HeaderFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "header" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedMessage.Header
member.summary: Metadata about this feed and feed message.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedMessage.EntityFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "entity" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedMessage.Entity
member.summary: Contents of the feed.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedHeader
member.summary: Metadata about a feed, included in feed messages.

member.summary: This timestamp identifies the moment when the content of this feed has been created (in server time). In POSIX time (i.e., number of seconds since January 1st 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedHeader.Types.Incrementality
member.summary: Determines whether the current fetch is incremental. Currently, DIFFERENTIAL mode is unsupported and behavior is unspecified for feeds that use this mode. There are discussions on the GTFS Realtime mailing list around fully specifying the behavior of DIFFERENTIAL mode and the documentation will be updated when those discussions are finalized.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedEntity
member.summary: A definition (or update) of an entity in the transit feed.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedEntity.IdFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "id" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedEntity.Id
member.summary: The ids are used only to provide incrementality support. The id should be unique within a FeedMessage. Consequent FeedMessages may contain FeedEntities with the same id. In case of a DIFFERENTIAL update the new FeedEntity with some id will replace the old FeedEntity with the same id (or delete it - see is_deleted below). The actual GTFS entities (e.g. stations, routes, trips) referenced by the feed must be specified by explicit selectors (see EntitySelector below for more info).

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedEntity.HasId
member.summary: Gets whether the "id" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.FeedEntity.ClearId

member.summary: Field number for the "is_deleted" field.

member.summary: Whether this entity is to be deleted. Relevant only for incremental fetches.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate
member.summary:
Realtime update of the progress of a vehicle along a trip. Depending on the value of ScheduleRelationship, a TripUpdate can specify: - A trip that proceeds along the schedule. - A trip that proceeds along a route but has no fixed schedule. - A trip that have been added or removed with regard to schedule.
The updates can be for future, predicted arrival/departure events, or for past events that already occurred. Normally, updates should get more precise and more certain (see uncertainty below) as the events gets closer to current time. Even if that is not possible, the information for past events should be precise and certain. In particular, if an update points to time in the past but its update's uncertainty is not 0, the client should conclude that the update is a (wrong) prediction and that the trip has not completed yet.
Note that the update can describe a trip that is already completed. To this end, it is enough to provide an update for the last stop of the trip. If the time of that is in the past, the client will conclude from that that the whole trip is in the past (it is possible, although inconsequential, to also provide updates for preceding stops). This option is most relevant for a trip that has completed ahead of schedule, but according to the schedule, the trip is still proceeding at the current time. Removing the updates for this trip could make the client assume that the trip is still proceeding. Note that the feed provider is allowed, but not required, to purge past updates - this is one case where this would be practically useful.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.TripFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "trip" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Trip
member.summary: The Trip that this message applies to. There can be at most one TripUpdate entity for each actual trip instance. If there is none, that means there is no prediction information available. It does *not* mean that the trip is progressing according to schedule.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.VehicleFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "vehicle" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Vehicle
member.summary: Additional information on the vehicle that is serving this trip.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.StopTimeUpdateFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "stop_time_update" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.StopTimeUpdate
member.summary:
Updates to StopTimes for the trip (both future, i.e., predictions, and in some cases, past ones, i.e., those that already happened). The updates must be sorted by stop_sequence, and apply for all the following stops of the trip up to the next specified one.
Example 1: For a trip with 20 stops, a StopTimeUpdate with arrival delay and departure delay of 0 for stop_sequence of the current stop means that the trip is exactly on time.
Example 2: For the same trip instance, 3 StopTimeUpdates are provided: - delay of 5 min for stop_sequence 3 - delay of 1 min for stop_sequence 8 - delay of unspecified duration for stop_sequence 10 This will be interpreted as: - stop_sequences 3,4,5,6,7 have delay of 5 min. - stop_sequences 8,9 have delay of 1 min. - stop_sequences 10,... have unknown delay.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.TimestampFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "timestamp" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Timestamp
member.summary: Moment at which the vehicle's real-time progress was measured. In POSIX time (i.e., the number of seconds since January 1st 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.HasTimestamp
member.summary: Gets whether the "timestamp" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.ClearTimestamp
member.summary: Clears the value of the "timestamp" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.DelayFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "delay" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Delay
member.summary:
The current schedule deviation for the trip. Delay should only be specified when the prediction is given relative to some existing schedule in GTFS.
Delay (in seconds) can be positive (meaning that the vehicle is late) or negative (meaning that the vehicle is ahead of schedule). Delay of 0 means that the vehicle is exactly on time.
Delay information in StopTimeUpdates take precedent of trip-level delay information, such that trip-level delay is only propagated until the next stop along the trip with a StopTimeUpdate delay value specified.
Feed providers are strongly encouraged to provide a TripUpdate.timestamp value indicating when the delay value was last updated, in order to evaluate the freshness of the data.
NOTE: This field is still experimental, and subject to change. It may be formally adopted in the future.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.HasDelay
member.summary: Gets whether the "delay" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.ClearDelay
member.summary: Clears the value of the "delay" field

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the TripUpdate message type.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent
member.summary:
Timing information for a single predicted event (either arrival or departure). Timing consists of delay and/or estimated time, and uncertainty. - delay should be used when the prediction is given relative to some existing schedule in GTFS. - time should be given whether there is a predicted schedule or not. If both time and delay are specified, time will take precedence (although normally, time, if given for a scheduled trip, should be equal to scheduled time in GTFS + delay).
Uncertainty applies equally to both time and delay. The uncertainty roughly specifies the expected error in true delay (but note, we don't yet define its precise statistical meaning). It's possible for the uncertainty to be 0, for example for trains that are driven under computer timing control.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.DelayFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "delay" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.Delay
member.summary: Delay (in seconds) can be positive (meaning that the vehicle is late) or negative (meaning that the vehicle is ahead of schedule). Delay of 0 means that the vehicle is exactly on time.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.HasDelay
member.summary: Gets whether the "delay" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.ClearDelay
member.summary: Clears the value of the "delay" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.TimeFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "time" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.Time
member.summary: Event as absolute time. In Unix time (i.e., number of seconds since January 1st 1970 00:00:00 UTC).

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.HasTime
member.summary: Gets whether the "time" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.ClearTime
member.summary: Clears the value of the "time" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.UncertaintyFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "uncertainty" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.Uncertainty
member.summary: If uncertainty is omitted, it is interpreted as unknown. If the prediction is unknown or too uncertain, the delay (or time) field should be empty. In such case, the uncertainty field is ignored. To specify a completely certain prediction, set its uncertainty to 0.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.HasUncertainty
member.summary: Gets whether the "uncertainty" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeEvent.ClearUncertainty
member.summary: Clears the value of the "uncertainty" field

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeUpdate
member.summary: Realtime update for arrival and/or departure events for a given stop on a trip. Updates can be supplied for both past and future events. The producer is allowed, although not required, to drop past events.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeUpdate.StopSequenceFieldNumber

member.summary: Must be the same as in stop_times.txt in the corresponding GTFS feed.

member.summary: Must be the same as in stops.txt in the corresponding GTFS feed.

member.summary: Gets whether the "schedule_relationship" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeUpdate.ClearScheduleRelationship

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeUpdate.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the StopTimeUpdate message type.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeUpdate.Types.ScheduleRelationship
member.summary: The relation between this StopTime and the static schedule.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeUpdate.Types.ScheduleRelationship.Scheduled
member.summary: The vehicle is proceeding in accordance with its static schedule of stops, although not necessarily according to the times of the schedule. At least one of arrival and departure must be provided. If the schedule for this stop contains both arrival and departure times then so must this update.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeUpdate.Types.ScheduleRelationship.Skipped
member.summary: The stop is skipped, i.e., the vehicle will not stop at this stop. Arrival and departure are optional.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripUpdate.Types.StopTimeUpdate.Types.ScheduleRelationship.NoData
member.summary: No data is given for this stop. The main intention for this value is to give the predictions only for part of a trip, i.e., if the last update for a trip has a NO_DATA specifier, then StopTimes for the rest of the stops in the trip are considered to be unspecified as well. Neither arrival nor departure should be supplied.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the VehiclePosition message type.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.VehicleStopStatus.IncomingAt
member.summary: The vehicle is just about to arrive at the stop (on a stop display, the vehicle symbol typically flashes).

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.VehicleStopStatus.StoppedAt
member.summary: The vehicle is standing at the stop.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.VehicleStopStatus.InTransitTo
member.summary: The vehicle has departed and is in transit to the next stop.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.CongestionLevel
member.summary: Congestion level that is affecting this vehicle.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.CongestionLevel.SevereCongestion
member.summary: People leaving their cars.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.OccupancyStatus
member.summary: The degree of passenger occupancy of the vehicle. This field is still experimental, and subject to change. It may be formally adopted in the future.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.OccupancyStatus.Empty
member.summary: The vehicle is considered empty by most measures, and has few or no passengers onboard, but is still accepting passengers.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.OccupancyStatus.ManySeatsAvailable
member.summary: The vehicle has a relatively large percentage of seats available. What percentage of free seats out of the total seats available is to be considered large enough to fall into this category is determined at the discretion of the producer.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.OccupancyStatus.FewSeatsAvailable
member.summary: The vehicle has a relatively small percentage of seats available. What percentage of free seats out of the total seats available is to be considered small enough to fall into this category is determined at the discretion of the feed producer.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.OccupancyStatus.StandingRoomOnly
member.summary: The vehicle can currently accommodate only standing passengers.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.OccupancyStatus.CrushedStandingRoomOnly
member.summary: The vehicle can currently accommodate only standing passengers and has limited space for them.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.OccupancyStatus.Full
member.summary: The vehicle is considered full by most measures, but may still be allowing passengers to board.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehiclePosition.Types.OccupancyStatus.NotAcceptingPassengers
member.summary: The vehicle is not accepting additional passengers.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Alert.HeaderText
member.summary: Alert header. Contains a short summary of the alert text as plain-text.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Alert.DescriptionTextFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "description_text" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Alert.DescriptionText
member.summary: Full description for the alert as plain-text. The information in the description should add to the information of the header.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Alert.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the Alert message type.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Alert.Types.Cause
member.summary: Cause of this alert.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Alert.Types.Cause.OtherCause
member.summary: Not machine-representable.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Alert.Types.Cause.Strike
member.summary: Public transit agency employees stopped working.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Alert.Types.Cause.Demonstration
member.summary: People are blocking the streets.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Alert.Types.Effect
member.summary: What is the effect of this problem on the affected entity.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Alert.Types.Effect.SignificantDelays
member.summary: We don't care about INsignificant delays: they are hard to detect, have little impact on the user, and would clutter the results as they are too frequent.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TimeRange
member.summary: A time interval. The interval is considered active at time 't' if 't' is greater than or equal to the start time and less than the end time.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TimeRange.StartFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "start" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TimeRange.Start
member.summary: Start time, in POSIX time (i.e., number of seconds since January 1st 1970 00:00:00 UTC). If missing, the interval starts at minus infinity.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TimeRange.HasStart
member.summary: Gets whether the "start" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TimeRange.ClearStart
member.summary: Clears the value of the "start" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TimeRange.EndFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "end" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TimeRange.End
member.summary: End time, in POSIX time (i.e., number of seconds since January 1st 1970 00:00:00 UTC). If missing, the interval ends at plus infinity.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TimeRange.HasEnd
member.summary: Gets whether the "end" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TimeRange.ClearEnd
member.summary: Clears the value of the "end" field

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position
member.summary: A position.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.HasLongitude
member.summary: Gets whether the "longitude" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.ClearLongitude
member.summary: Clears the value of the "longitude" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.BearingFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "bearing" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.Bearing
member.summary: Bearing, in degrees, clockwise from North, i.e., 0 is North and 90 is East. This can be the compass bearing, or the direction towards the next stop or intermediate location. This should not be direction deduced from the sequence of previous positions, which can be computed from previous data.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.HasBearing
member.summary: Gets whether the "bearing" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.ClearBearing
member.summary: Clears the value of the "bearing" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.OdometerFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "odometer" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.Odometer
member.summary: Odometer value, in meters.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.HasOdometer
member.summary: Gets whether the "odometer" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.ClearOdometer
member.summary: Clears the value of the "odometer" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.SpeedFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "speed" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.Speed
member.summary: Momentary speed measured by the vehicle, in meters per second.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.Position.HasSpeed
member.summary: Gets whether the "speed" field is set

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor
member.summary: A descriptor that identifies an instance of a GTFS trip, or all instances of a trip along a route. - To specify a single trip instance, the trip_id (and if necessary, start_time) is set. If route_id is also set, then it should be same as one that the given trip corresponds to. - To specify all the trips along a given route, only the route_id should be set. Note that if the trip_id is not known, then stop sequence ids in TripUpdate are not sufficient, and stop_ids must be provided as well. In addition, absolute arrival/departure times must be provided.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.TripIdFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "trip_id" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.TripId
member.summary: The trip_id from the GTFS feed that this selector refers to. For non frequency-based trips, this field is enough to uniquely identify the trip. For frequency-based trip, start_time and start_date might also be necessary.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.HasTripId
member.summary: Gets whether the "trip_id" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.ClearTripId
member.summary: Clears the value of the "trip_id" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.RouteIdFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "route_id" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.RouteId
member.summary: The route_id from the GTFS that this selector refers to.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.HasRouteId
member.summary: Gets whether the "route_id" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.ClearRouteId
member.summary: Clears the value of the "route_id" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.DirectionIdFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "direction_id" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.DirectionId
member.summary: The direction_id from the GTFS feed trips.txt file, indicating the direction of travel for trips this selector refers to. This field is still experimental, and subject to change. It may be formally adopted in the future.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.HasDirectionId
member.summary: Gets whether the "direction_id" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.ClearDirectionId
member.summary: Clears the value of the "direction_id" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.StartTimeFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "start_time" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.StartTime
member.summary: The initially scheduled start time of this trip instance. When the trip_id corresponds to a non-frequency-based trip, this field should either be omitted or be equal to the value in the GTFS feed. When the trip_id corresponds to a frequency-based trip, the start_time must be specified for trip updates and vehicle positions. If the trip corresponds to exact_times=1 GTFS record, then start_time must be some multiple (including zero) of headway_secs later than frequencies.txt start_time for the corresponding time period. If the trip corresponds to exact_times=0, then its start_time may be arbitrary, and is initially expected to be the first departure of the trip. Once established, the start_time of this frequency-based trip should be considered immutable, even if the first departure time changes -- that time change may instead be reflected in a StopTimeUpdate. Format and semantics of the field is same as that of GTFS/frequencies.txt/start_time, e.g., 11:15:35 or 25:15:35.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.HasStartTime
member.summary: Gets whether the "start_time" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.ClearStartTime
member.summary: Clears the value of the "start_time" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.StartDateFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "start_date" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.StartDate
member.summary: The scheduled start date of this trip instance. Must be provided to disambiguate trips that are so late as to collide with a scheduled trip on a next day. For example, for a train that departs 8:00 and 20:00 every day, and is 12 hours late, there would be two distinct trips on the same time. This field can be provided but is not mandatory for schedules in which such collisions are impossible - for example, a service running on hourly schedule where a vehicle that is one hour late is not considered to be related to schedule anymore. In YYYYMMDD format.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.HasStartDate
member.summary: Gets whether the "start_date" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.ClearStartDate
member.summary: Clears the value of the "start_date" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.ScheduleRelationshipFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "schedule_relationship" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.HasScheduleRelationship
member.summary: Gets whether the "schedule_relationship" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.ClearScheduleRelationship
member.summary: Clears the value of the "schedule_relationship" field

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the TripDescriptor message type.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.Types.ScheduleRelationship
member.summary: The relation between this trip and the static schedule. If a trip is done in accordance with temporary schedule, not reflected in GTFS, then it shouldn't be marked as SCHEDULED, but likely as ADDED.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.Types.ScheduleRelationship.Scheduled
member.summary: Trip that is running in accordance with its GTFS schedule, or is close enough to the scheduled trip to be associated with it.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.Types.ScheduleRelationship.Added
member.summary: An extra trip that was added in addition to a running schedule, for example, to replace a broken vehicle or to respond to sudden passenger load.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.Types.ScheduleRelationship.Unscheduled
member.summary: A trip that is running with no schedule associated to it, for example, if there is no schedule at all.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TripDescriptor.Types.ScheduleRelationship.Canceled
member.summary: A trip that existed in the schedule but was removed.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehicleDescriptor
member.summary: Identification information for the vehicle performing the trip.

member.summary: Field number for the "label" field.

member.summary: Gets whether the "label" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.VehicleDescriptor.ClearLabel
member.summary: Clears the value of the "label" field

member.summary: Field number for the "license_plate" field.

member.summary: The license plate of the vehicle.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString
member.summary: An internationalized message containing per-language versions of a snippet of text or a URL. One of the strings from a message will be picked up. The resolution proceeds as follows: 1. If the UI language matches the language code of a translation, the first matching translation is picked. 2. If a default UI language (e.g., English) matches the language code of a translation, the first matching translation is picked. 3. If some translation has an unspecified language code, that translation is picked.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString.TranslationFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "translation" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString.Translation
member.summary: At least one translation must be provided.

member.name: T:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the TranslatedString message type.

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString.Types.Translation.TextFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "text" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString.Types.Translation.Text
member.summary: A UTF-8 string containing the message.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString.Types.Translation.HasText
member.summary: Gets whether the "text" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString.Types.Translation.ClearText
member.summary: Clears the value of the "text" field

member.name: F:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString.Types.Translation.LanguageFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "language" field.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString.Types.Translation.Language
member.summary: BCP-47 language code. Can be omitted if the language is unknown or if no i18n is done at all for the feed. At most one translation is allowed to have an unspecified language tag.

member.name: P:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString.Types.Translation.HasLanguage
member.summary: Gets whether the "language" field is set

member.name: M:STM.ExternalServiceProvider.Proto.TranslatedString.Types.Translation.ClearLanguage
member.summary: Clears the value of the "language" field
